question: I have keys but no locks. I have space but no room. What am I?
What gets wetter as it dries?
What has hands but cannot clap?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
I’m full of holes but can hold water. What am I?
I go up but never come down. What am I?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
I’m tall when I’m young and short when I’m old. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What has one eye but cannot see?
I’m light as a feather, yet the strongest man can’t hold me for long. What am I?
What can you catch but not throw?
I have a neck but no head. What am I?
What has many teeth but cannot bite?
I am always in front of you but can’t be seen. What am I?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
I have cities, but no houses; forests, but no trees; and water, but no fish. What am I?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
What has words but never speaks?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
I’m always running but never move. What am I?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
The more of me you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
I have wings but cannot fly. What am I?
I have a spine but no bones. What am I?
What has an eye but cannot see?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
I’m always in the sky but never fall. What am I?
What belongs to you but is used more by others?
